entry.title: Ukrderzh­nats­menvydav (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Lviv branch of the Ukrderzh­nats­menvydav (building pictured) was the main publisher of Polish literature in the Soviet Union by 1941?

entry.title: Flypaper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that TV Guide criticized Flypaper as among the "second-rate rip-offs" of Tarantino's Pulp Fiction?

entry.title: Canadian League for Peace and Democracy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Canadian League for Peace and Democracy organized a 10,000-person rally at Maple Leaf Gardens in Toronto to protest a 2,500-person fascist rally?

entry.title: Abigail Larson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that illustrator Abigail Larson once designed a wine-bottle label for the Edgar Allan Poe Museum?

entry.title: Gorontalo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Indonesian city of Gorontalo is nicknamed the "Porch of Medina"?

entry.title: John Holahan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Holahan recalled both being called a "lunatic" by his school's president for seeking a football game at night and being told afterward by the president, "I was the lunatic, not you"?

entry.title: a country ballad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Beyoncé released a country ballad and an uptempo country pop western song on the same day?

entry.title: Paimon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some fans of Genshin Impact have referred to the character Paimon as "emergency food"?

entry.title: an extinct French scarab beetle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an extinct French scarab beetle was discovered in a Prague factory?
